intro: Carum anisum, commonly known as star anise, is a flowering plant native to China and other parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruit, which consists of 8–10 asymmetrical, oil-rich pods. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley, carrots, and dill. Its aromatic seeds are widely used in both culinary and medicinal applications. The essential oils extracted from the fruit contain anethole, which contributes to its characteristic licorice-like flavor and aroma.
